Dating: 27TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not before); LATE PERIOD; 31ST DYNASTY (not after)
Name: Pendant of flying Ba-bird
Description: The outline was first cut from a piece of gold foil, onto, which small strips of gold were soldered giving the shape of the body and the separate feathers, which were then inlaid with lapis lazuli and turquoise. The embossed underside of the Ba-bird, made of gold foil, has been soldered to the underneath. The upper surface of the head is hemispherical, made of embossed metal and set in. On the underside near the wing tips are two suspension loops made of thin strips of metal which have been cut and bent to shape.
